Instruction: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper.

Combine the dry ingredients like flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, buttermilk, and corn oil. Create a well in the center of the flour mixture and incorporate the buttermilk mixture. Add raisins, stir gently until a soft dough forms. Shape the dough into a ball on a floured surface using floured hands. Transfer the formed dough onto the baking sheet and cut a large cross on top with a sharp knife.
Bake the bread on a middle oven rack until it turns golden brown, for about 30 to 40 minutes.
